metadata.subject: This is business develpt to diagnose illness

organizations: Walter Reed Army Institute of Research (WRAIR)

relationships.description: Business development discussions regarding Fio Corporation's malaria diagnostic technology
Primary contact for business development and coordination
Military partnership for malaria diagnostic device testing
Discussions about potential Russian investment opportunities

analysis.purpose: To provide a business development update on Fio Corporation's malaria diagnostic technology and financing efforts, and to arrange meetings
analysis.significance: Shows business connections between high-profile individuals and a medical technology company seeking funding and government partnerships

notable_quotes: Colonel Colin Ohrt, MD, who is in charge of the relevant WRAIR program, called our device a game-changer.
He would like to pilot our device in Tanzania, Cambodia, Kenya, and Thailand.
Am in the midst of a $8-10 mn financing...Have in this time already closed approximately $2 mn, which is encouraging

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found - purely business communication

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - legitimate business communication about medical technology financing and government partnerships

public_knowledge.context: Business communication about medical technology development and financing that would not typically be public knowledge

analysis.summary: Email from Peter Mandelson forwarding a business update from Michael Greenberg about Fio Corporation's $8-10 million financing round and successful demonstrations of their malaria diagnostic device to US military (WRAIR) and USAID officials, with plans for international field trials and potential Russian investment opportunities.
